title: Eugene Marve
text:
Eugene Raymond Marve (August 14, 1960 – May 24, 2021) was an American professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="linebacker">linebacker</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL) for the <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a>, <a href="Tampa%20Bay%20Buccaneers">Tampa Bay Buccaneers</a>, and the <a href="San%20Diego%20Chargers">San Diego Chargers</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Saginaw%20Valley%20State%20University">Saginaw Valley State University</a>.
His son, <a href="Robert%20Marve">Robert Marve</a>, won the <a href="Florida%20Mr.%20Football%20Award">Florida Mr. Football Award</a> in 2007 and was the starting quarterback at the <a href="Miami%20Hurricanes%20football">University of Miami</a>, before transferring to <a href="Purdue%20Boilermakers%20football">Purdue University</a>.
He died on May 24, 2021, at the age of 60.
